ogTitle: president-elect joe biden as 400 candles were lit on the lincoln memorial reflecting pool to honor the 400,000+ americans who have died from covid-19. - smarther news
ogDescription: it's hard sometimes to remember, but that's how we heal. it's important to do that as a nation.
quote: It's hard sometimes to remember, but that's how we heal. It's important to do that as a nation.
summary: President-elect Joe Biden as 400 candles were lit on the Lincoln Memorial Reflecting Pool to honor the 400,000+ Americans who have died from Covid-19.
body:
• The Tuesday night memorial was the first major event for President-elect Biden and VP-elect Harris ahead of Wednesday’s inauguration.
  • Pres-elect Biden has set the goal of  administering the COVID-19 vaccine to 100 million Americans within the first 100 days of his administration.
  • Why It Matters: While the national focus has turned to politics, the pandemic continues to challenge policy makers and healthcare providers alike. Recent statistics show that 2 Americans die every minute from the new coronavirus.

Here’s a good overview of the latest news on COVID-19.

More background on the memorial and full video of the ceremony.
